trait.name: Spherical errors (nearsightedness and farsightedness)
trait.description: Spherical errors are refractive errors where the image is focused either in front or behind the retina, making the image blurry. Spherical errors include myopia (nearsightedness) and hyperopia (farsightedness).

trait.name: High-grade myopia
trait.description: High-grade myopia, or severe nearsightedness, is defined as having myopia measuring at -6 diopters or worse.

trait.name: Spherical errors
trait.description: Spherical errors contribute to the degree (severity) of myopia (nearsightedness) and hyperopia (farsightedness). Diopters are units that describe the degree of myopia and hyperopia. A negative diopter value means nearsighted and a positive diopter value means farsighted.
